Classical.Structure: Polymer of tubulin; a key component of the cytoskeleton.
Classical.Function: Provides structural support, intracellular transport, and forms the mitotic spindle during cell division.
Classical.Pathology: Disruption linked to neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Alzheimer's) and cancer.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: The primary L1 substrate. A quasi-crystalline lattice supporting coherent quantum vibratory states (phonons) via metabolically-driven Fröhlich condensation. Functions as a topological quantum error correction (QEC) system. [cite: 1477, 1682, 1683, 1697, 2273]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The internal scaffold of reality; the structure upon which information is written and computed.

Falsification_Hypotheses: THz/Brillouin/Raman spectroscopy will show no coherent vibrational modes. [cite: 1494]
Observed modes will persist unaltered during anesthetic wash-in/out, falsifying a link to consciousness. [cite: 1494, 1727]
The calculated energy gap (Δ ≈ 1.64 eV) will be shown to be incorrect, or thermal error rates will not be suppressed as predicted (P_error ~ 10^-27). [cite: 1710, 1711, 2380, 2381]
Experimental_Protocols: Protocol 1: MT Coherence (THz Spectroscopy): Femtosecond pump-probe THz spectroscopy on purified tubulin to detect quantum beats and measure coherence time (tau). [cite: 4107-4112]
Protocol 2: Anesthetic Dampening: Re-run Protocol 1 during exposure to anaesthetics (e.g., halothane) to check for predicted dampening of quantum modes. [cite: 1727]

KeyEquations_LaTeX: Wavefunction: \psi_{MT}(x, t) = A e^{i(\omega_Q t - kx)} [cite: 1682, 1696]
QEC Hamiltonian: H_{topo} = -J \sum_{p} B_p - J \sum_{s} A_s [cite: 1685, 1706, 2377]
Thermal Error Probability: P_{error} \approx e^{-\Delta/kT} \approx e^{-61.4} \approx 10^{-27} [cite: 1688, 1711, 2286]
